storyInfo: Friston-3 dreams, despite never having been fitted with the capability to do so by Closure. Popukar wakes up to see unfamiliar figures on the ship's portholes. Something strange is happening to Rhodes Island.

attributes.content: Friston does not understand why his daughter chose this as their meeting place.
This is no vacation spot. Too much sand in one's shoes.
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: I should take a break.
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: He sits on a dune and removes his shoes, only for the wind to send the sand he pours out into his face.
*cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: This is most undignified—why am I in full dress?
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: Why did she ask me to come here?
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: There is no answer on the radio. He wanders aimlessly on the yellow sands, calling his daughter's name.
No one answers until night has fallen.
...A party?
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: He follows the sound to find the camp on the dunes in the distance, filled with lights and ribbons.
He hears his daughter's familiar laughter, and runs towards her in joy.
You made it to my wedding, dad!
attributes.name: 'Daughter'

attributes.content: Friston almost cries at the sight of the golden hair.
I've been looking for you for so long, my sunshine.
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: Is this your wedding?
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: Of course. The ceremony is about to start. Let's go.
attributes.name: 'Daughter'

attributes.content: We'll walk the red carpet, arm in arm. Give me your blessings, dad.
attributes.name: 'Daughter'

attributes.content: Friston tries to take her arm, but he can not reach it.
Will you not give me your blessing?
attributes.name: 'Daughter'

attributes.content: No... no, that’s not what I meant... I—
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: (Unknown Language) I—
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: Will you not give me your blessing?
attributes.name: Disjointed Voice

attributes.content: (Unknown Language) ...Sunshine?
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: You did not want us to see the truth of the stars?
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: (Unknown language) ...You're not my sunshine.
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Have I left home? I remember this bunker—
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: (Unknown language) 'The preservation room'.
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: You will not answer any more of my questions?
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Kristen. You're Kristen...
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I've heard of you. No, I've seen you... no. How did I know you?
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I've never known you—
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Who the devil turned off the light?!
attributes.name: Trevor Friston

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Damn it!
attributes.name: Friston

attributes.content: Why have you imprisoned me here?
attributes.name: Friston

attributes.content: Closure! Is this another one of your damned jokes?
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: Friston realizes that he is buried in the 'photos' that fill the room. A volume of 'A Complete Bestiary of Terra' covers his camera module.
Are they even photos? He has never visited the places in them, nor could he ever.
There are only fragmented images on the countless photos.
Sand dune, bonfire, camp, golden hair, and the preservation room where the sun does not shine.
A dream...?
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: Friston dreamed. Friston-3 dreamed.
He printed his own dream.
It should not be possible for me to dream. Did Closure upload a new firmware without telling me?
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: I don't have time to argue with you right now, Mr. Friston!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I guarantee you in the strongest possible terms that I have not uploaded any firmware that could have caused you to dream.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The PRTS anomalies are getting out of control. It will take time to deploy the backup command system.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: All the work has to be assigned manually. I wish I had six or seven pairs of eyes! We've completely lost contact with some areas and we have no idea what's going on—
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Relax, Closure.
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: I'm not trying to argue with you. I just want to make sure that all possibilities for my unusual malfunctions are accounted for.
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: We've eliminated firmware bugs and hardware malfunctions as possibilities. Then—
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Answer me, Closure... this is important...
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: What is the energy source that powers my core?
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: Huh? Originium, of course.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Are the majority of your retrofitted operation platforms Originium-powered?
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: ...Your tone is starting to scare me, Mr. Friston. What are you trying to say?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: You're a genius, Closure.
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Excellent thinking, cutting off the link between the retrofitted operation platforms and PRTS. But that's not enough, not by a long shot.
attributes.name: Friston-3

attributes.content: Huh? What's going on? Why are things shaking?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Popukar was awakened by the continuous flashing. She looks out of the porthole, but sees nothing unusual outside.
Looks like a nice day. No sign of rain.
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Maybe somebody was training noisily outside?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Hm... PRTS comms are still down?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Looks like today's assignment is in the isolation zone outside the ship. I should report to Orchid.
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Morning—hey, where did everybody go?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: It's so quiet... where is Orchid? I can't reach her...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: I should check the cafeteria.
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: The cafeteria's... this way—
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Popukar's sleepy eyes are only half-open, but she could find her way from the deck to the cafeteria even if they were completely shut.
That is how well she knows Rhodes Island—
Wh-Whoa, whoaaaa!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: O-Ouch, that hurts...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: She is tripped by a toolbox from the Engineering Department left in the corridor.
I thought Engineering was done with working in this area...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: So careless!
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: She kneels down to rub her knee, which doesn't hurt so much anymore, then puts the scattered tools and boxes away to the sides of the corridor.
That light again... what...?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Popukar stands up and looks to the porthole next to her—
She sees many strange people.
Who are they?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: New visitors...?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: The other side of the porthole is supposed to be the deck. Are these people lost?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: She walks briskly through the corridor, but begins to slow down as she becomes increasingly confused.
Why do I see them on every porthole?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: O-Orchid? This is Popukar.
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Seems like communications are still down. I don't know if I'm getting through to you...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Are you seeing anything weird?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: There is no response from the communicator.
(Unknown language) When true destruction... on me... powerless...
attributes.name: Faint Voice Outside the Porthole

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Equal end...
attributes.name: Faint Voice Outside the Porthole

attributes.content: A-Are they talking? I can't hear...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Th-The mission comes first. Maybe Orchid is already waiting for me in the isolation zone outside.
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: A left turn here...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Go straight, then push the door open...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Then the exit passage—
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Let me get to the ground first...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: I think I'm here...
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: Popukar turns around to look at the exit passage that she came out of, only to find that it has disappeared.
Popukar! We were looking for you. Everyone else is here—
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: Is something wrong?
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: O-Orchid... is the exit passage here?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: What exit passage?
attributes.name: Orchid

attributes.content: —*Bzzt* All operators... receiving this message...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Do not... trust...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Communications... blocked... Rhodes Island... awake...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: —Repeat... *Bzzt* Warning—
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: ...Closure?
attributes.name: Popukar

attributes.content: (Advances hesitantly)
(Hostile posture)
attributes.name: Pained 'Beepy'

attributes.content: I'm sorry, little fella, but I can't let you hurt anyone else.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: (Spins angrily)
attributes.name: Pained 'Beepy'

attributes.content: Why did you attack us?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I'm not sure what's going on, but something must be wrong with the ship.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You went missing for a while, and this is what became of you when you came back.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Besides, the structure of the ship seems to be changing. I could hardly find my way.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Such a strange feeling. It's like... like the ship is—
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Like it's alive.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Impossible... we had set up an isolation zone around Rhodes Island. We should have gotten a warning if any enemies had approached.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Unless... the enemy was from within.

attributes.content: I'm not sure... we're in the command center, but we're not getting any information about what's going on anywhere on the ship!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: No response from Dr. Kal'tsit or any of the elite operators to our messages, either...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I'll go find them.;Let's get everyone together. Then we can think about how to deal with this.

attributes.content: Okay. I'll protect you.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: (Approaches silently)
attributes.name: Originium Entity

attributes.content: What is—?!
attributes.name: Amiya
